intro: Silene angustifolia subsp. vulgaris, commonly known as the narrowleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Silene angustifolia subsp. vulgaris is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its showy, often pink or red flowers.
